actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to supplement Federal funds for higher education by providing a procedure under which individuals may contribute with their income tax returns up to $10 of any refund for purposes of providing funds for Federal student financial assistance programs.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals to contribute up to ten dollars of any income tax refund to Federal student financial assistance programs. Identifies such programs as any student financial assistance programs established under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to supplement Federal funds for higher education by providing a procedure under which individuals may contribute with their income tax returns up to $10 of any refund for purposes of providing funds for Federal student financial assistance programs.
